title.narrative: Bahia Poor Urban Areas Integrated Development

description.narrative: The Projects development objective is to reduce urban poverty in a sustainable manner, targeting the poorest and most vulnerable sections of Salvador and strategic cities of the state of Bahia with access to basic services and improved housing and social support services. This development objective is aligned with the Millennium Development Goals MDGs (especially Goal 7, Target 11) in line with the growing number of governments around the world that are launching comprehensive slum upgrading programs, setting development targets, undertaking reforms to prevent the growth of new slums, and leveraging public and private resources to improve the lives of slum dwellers.

title.narrative: Increase in the index of satisfaction with the provision of new social equipments in the intervention areas (baseline 2010)

comment.narrative: Baseline was provided based on surveys conducted in June 2012.
25% increase above the baseline.
Surveys of a sample community to be conducted in November 2013 in advance of the preparation of the ICR.

title.narrative: Increase in the index of satisfaction with basic sanitation conditions in the intervention areas (baseline 2010)

comment.narrative: Baseline was revised based on surveys conducted in June 2012.
25% increase above the baseline.
Surveys of a sample community from same baseline group to be conducted in November 2013 in advance of the preparation of the ICR.

title.narrative: A2. Percentage of households in high risk areas or unhealthy conditions resettled

comment.narrative: Universe of 1638 households as defined at PAD preparation
Info as provided by the Borrower’s Monitoring Report.

title.narrative: A3. Number of households removed from high risk areas or unhealthy conditions

comment.narrative: 1332 of households were taken out of risk areas and resettled in a different location; 293 remained in place through technicalinterventions that eliminated risky conditions. Info as provided by the Borrower’s Monitoring Report.

title.narrative: A5. Number of households benefiting from urban infrastructure interventions

comment.narrative: Borrower only included households with completed units with finalized land titles. The reported results do not reflect land titlesto be issued upon completion of housing units past the closing date, or those still in processing. By April 2014, the indicatorvalue is expected to reach 2,081. For breakdown of units by project area, please refer to the attached UGP reports on resultsindicators. Info as provided by the Borrower's Monitoring Report. Legal instruments (CDRUs) still to be issued.

title.narrative: A4. Number of households with secure ownership of their home (able to be benefited with land regularization - habilitado)

comment.narrative: Borrower only included households with completed units with finalized land titles. The reported results do not reflect land titlesto be issued upon completion of housing units past the closing date, or those still in processing. By April 2014, the indicatorvalue is expected to reach 2,081. For breakdown of units by project area, please refer to the attached UGP reports on resultsindicators. Info as provided by the Borrower's Monitoring Report. Legal instruments (CDRUs) still to be issued.

title.narrative: A1. Number of households with improved housing conditions (new, improved, indemnities)

comment.narrative: Calculated by adding new units built, improved units, and monitored indemnizations (not including pure cash transfers). Forbreakdown of units by project area, please refer to the attached UGP reports on results indicators. Info as provided by theBorrower’s Monitoring Report.

title.narrative: B2. Number of direct beneficiaries of social activities of the Project

comment.narrative: Info as provided by the Borrower’s Monitoring Report.

title.narrative: B1. Installation of Local Technical Offices

comment.narrative: Info as provided by the Borrower’s Monitoring Report.

title.narrative: B4. Number of young people (ages 11-29) directly benefitting from social activities of the Project

comment.narrative: Info as provided by the Borrower’s Monitoring Report.

title.narrative: C3. Number of community meetings held

comment.narrative: Info as provided by the Borrower’s Monitoring Report.

title.narrative: B3. Number of beneficiaries attending socio-professional training activities

comment.narrative: Info as provided by the Borrower’s Monitoring Report.

title.narrative: B5. Number of social organizations strengthened by the Project

comment.narrative: Shown as less than prior results reported due to errors in data reporting not taken into account in previous ISRs. Clientcorrectedthe error and reported accurate data at last supervision mission.Info as provided by the Borrower’s Monitoring Report.Info as provided by the Borrower’s Monitoring Report.

title.narrative: C2. Percent implementation of tools for Project management

comment.narrative: The Municipal GIS / database was implemented. Info as provided by the Borrower's Monitoring Report.

title.narrative: C1. Number of O&M plans prepared by target municipalities

comment.narrative: The management plan for Anchieta Ave (in Feira de Santana) is complete and only pending signature by the Mayor. Info as providedbythe Borrower's Monitoring Report.

title.narrative: Improved infrastructure and social services: Increase in the percentage of households within a 1 km radius of social equipments (improved park, public plaza, soccer fields, community center)

comment.narrative: UGP to provide information by November 2013 in advance of the preparation of the ICR.

title.narrative: Improved infrastructure and social services: Increase in the percentage of households with access to sanitation networks (availability of sanitation services)

comment.narrative: UGP to provide information by November 2013 in advance of the preparation of the ICR.

title.narrative: Improved infrastructure and social services: Increase in the percentage of households within 250 meters of paved roads

comment.narrative: UGP to provide information by November 2013 in advance of the preparation of the ICR.
